website_summaries.verdict: Far from perfect, this is nonetheless an essential accessory for any new MacBook owner.
pros: Conveniently adds an SD card slot, a miniSD slot and two USB 3.0 ports to your MacBook's USB-C port
cons: The drive doesn't fit securely enough and could easily fall out if you're not careful
The pass-through USB-C port can only be used for charging, not data transfers

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful but didn't work
customer_reviews.text: Loved the way this looked and integrated so shortly with my MacBook. However, my USB drives only work 25% of the time that I plug them in with this adapter. Very frustrating! Also noted that the design of this adapter does tend itself toward potential damage to the adapter or your usb c port. Because it's so long, it's easily twisted and broken at the usb c connector. Just an observation with this type of adapter. For this many connections, you are safer with a separate hub that plugs in via cable.
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: Looks nice. That's about it.
customer_reviews.text: The device looks nice. That's the only pro. The adapter worked for a couple of weeks and then stopped working. When I would plug it into my laptop it began making this wining noise and would heat up a lot (more than usual, as it does heat up during regular use). At that point it would not register anything plugged into it and I gave up because the sound didn't sound good at all. I am in the process of returning the item.
customer_reviews.author: Cayley Bridges

customer_reviews.title: Not very functional
customer_reviews.text: Product overall sucks for its functionality. It hangs extremely loosely as it's only being held by the USB c port, there's nothing else holding it up, therefore, it disconnects often with the littlest nudge. You would think there would be some sort of clamp to hold it securely instead of just relying on the port. Also good to note that it doesn't work any better with a case either. Overall wouldn't recommend, just a wired one instead of this garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: works great.
customer_reviews.text: sorry, initially I gave it 5 stars. the product was working great, no complain. received on Jan 17, plug it in and worked great. today Feb 1, my usb 3 HD started to flaking out, the connection the my mac started to disconnect randomly every few hours or so. after a few times, it causes my ext drive to get some corrupt file system sorry. I have to return this.
customer_reviews.author: Rudy Widjaja

customer_reviews.title: Questionable Quality, broken >10 uses
customer_reviews.text: Worked for about a month or 2, and now does not work anymore. Product looked sleek and cool, but I always had questions about it's quality and now those questions have been answered. This product has been used under 10 times and is now broken. My computer (2016 MacBook Pro) will no longer recognize any devices plugged into this. All I used this for was connecting SD cards to my computer. Will be contacting Satechi.
customer_reviews.author: Dylan Gamache

customer_reviews.title: It works, buy it.
customer_reviews.text: Less sturdy than I would like, but works as described. Its a pretty close match (but not perfect) to my Wife's 2nd gen Retina Macbook Pro. It may perfectly match the 1st get (which is slightly different).

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended

customer_reviews.title: USB 3 is consistent.  Don't buy if you rely on USB 3.0.
customer_reviews.text: USB 3.0 support is very inconsistent. Sometimes USB 3 devices work fine, other times they receive power, but no data connection is made. USB 2.0 works fine, and it has a decent build quality. Using it on a 2016 MacBook Pro, both in macOS and Windows 10.

I removed the case, but the best I got was an intermittent connection that would not persist through a sleep/wake cycle.

customer_reviews.title: OtherWorldComputing is advertising a nice USB-C hub for three times the price of this ...
customer_reviews.text: works as advertised. Most importantly: unlike the IVSO hub adapter that only claims it charges the MacBook while also connecting the USB devices, this one actually does it! I was able to connect to two portable HDs and do a hard-wired back-up while charging. OtherWorldComputing is advertising a nice USB-C hub for three times the price of this adapter; though it appears to be more complex, their promised delivery has slipped from September 2015 until today, and still counting... The only drawback of this adapter is that its physical connection to the MacBook, via the USB-C port, is flimsy. One has to be careful not to disconnect it by the sheer weight of the 3 cables attached to it....
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Custome+1+- n 1

customer_reviews.title: I am VERY impressed with Satechi
customer_reviews.text: I just bought this among a few other incredible Apple USB-C adapters. I am VERY impressed with Satechi and am going to buy more of their stuff in the future. Functionality? Yes. Heat problem? Not that I've seen. Shows a power light NOT in the Apple power adapter/cable? Yes. Finally. Daisy chain USB-C for other data-driven needs? Haven't tried it, but the last thing I want to do is to connect a string of these (the power adapter does work through its USB-C). Might be nice if Satechi would clearly answer the question of what their USB-C port can be used for. Anyways, this is the best!

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed in the quality. Broke after 4 uses.

Purchased device back in January when it was first announced.Hopefully the company will replace the device under warranty as I have only used it a few times and never put any stress on it enough to break anything. Product also overheats when plugged in.
customer_reviews.author: WG

customer_reviews.title: Color matches nicely. Sits flush
customer_reviews.text: The product works as advertised, color matches nicely. Sits flush, no stress on the connector with SD cards and flash drivers. Charging through Macbook and operating with devices as iPhone 6 and flash USB 3.0 drives of several kinds, USB 2.0 and 3.0 external Hard Drives and SD cards. However, connecting a USB extension hub (with 4 ports), only the USB 2.0 including flash drives and 3.0 devices HD non flash will work properly, the flash USB 3.0 drives won't work with an extension Hub, due to OS X conflict which I hope it will be fixed with future OS X updates. It's a small delicate adapter so it has to be treated gently, nothing out of the ordinary.
customer_reviews.author: TechGeek

customer_reviews.title: ... of the macbook- the color is close to a perfect match as well

customer_reviews.title: I use to love this hub, until it broke my micro sd.
customer_reviews.text: I use to love this hub, until it broke my micro sd. I inserted my micro sd into the slot, and it went much further than it usually does. I had to really pull out the micro sd, and next thing you know, my micro sd card had error messages. I plugged it into my other computer using a micro sd card adapter, and it burned through the adapter (yes the micro sd card, since it was broken, because of the satechi hub, it burned the adapter......) I lost all my data on that sd card. User error? Maybe a little. But definitely, mostly a product error.

customer_reviews.title: Good idea, poor design
customer_reviews.text: Pretty poorly designed. With just a touch the port will disconnect from your computer, which can be awful when your in the middle of data transfer. I even opened it up and made sure the USB-C insert was sticking out of the body as far as possible to make sure it would insert securely as possible. Another problem is that it gets pretty hot. It may be that this product is just optimized for the MacBook, as opposed to the MacBook Pro 2016. Because the MacBook is thinner it will be able to rest on whatever surface you are using and be less prone to disconnecting. But be advised if you own the Pro, it will come out very easily.
customer_reviews.author: Heather C. Lindquist

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product. Got it for my friend and I ...

When it does charge it takes hours to charge 20% of the battery. What a terrible investment this was.

More importantly, neither of the USB ports on the hub work on the hub (which is really the reason I bought this thing in the first place). Not sure if the hardware is at fault, or there's an issue with Mac peripheral drivers, but I kinda needed this thing to just work.

product_meta.title: Satechi Aluminum Type-C USB 3.0 3-in-1 Combo Hub with USB-C Pass-Through - Compatible with 2018 MacBook Air, 2018 iPad Pro, 2015/2016/2017 MacBook 12-Inch and More
product_meta.description:
Color:SilverThe new and improved Type-C Hub is here. Still offering everything you loved from our Type-C USB 3.0 Hub, the Pass Through USB Hub now offers a USB-C Port enabling your Macbook 12” to be charged while the adapter is plugged in. Thanks to the Satechi Type-C Pass Through USB Hub, you can charge your Macbook as well as easily convert a Type-C USB port to two USB 3.0 ports, and SD card slot, and a Micro SD card slot.

Beautiful Design
The aluminum hub is the perfect complement to Apple computers and accessories. The elegant Type-C Pass Through Hub is available in Space Gray, Silver, and Gold.

Multi-Use
Use the Type-C Pass Through Hub with USB peripherals and devices, as well as SD and Micro cards. Accessing your media is easy with the Satechi Hub-and no drivers are required!

Compact
The small size makes the Type-C Pass Through USB Hub easy to fit into a purse, backpack, or laptop bag. No matter where your travels take you, you won’t be far from the convenience of accessing your favorite USB devices!

Important Notes
The Micro SD and SD card slot are not able to be used simultaneously. 
Not compatible with Apple SuperDrive. 
Operating temperature is 86-122°F. 

1 Year Manufacture Warranty
feature_bullets: EXPAND YOUR TYPE-C PORT - features two USB 3.0 ports, a SD and Micro SD card slot, and a charging port
SLIM & COMPACT - compact and easy-to-use design makes it simple to take the Type-C USB Hub with you anywhere you go
SLEEK, MODERN DESIGN - brushed aluminum design complements your Apple accessories
PLUG & PLAY - does not require any software, drivers, or complicated installation process

COMPATIBILITY - 2020/2018 MacBook Air, 2020/2018 iPad Pro, 2017/2016/2015 MacBook 12-inch, 2019/2018/2017 MacBook Pro 13-inch (29W max output), Microsoft Surface Go, Google Chromebook and most Type-C products with Power Delivery protocol (2.0 or higher)

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.3 out of 5 stars874 ratings3.3 out of 5 stars
